unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, results are out, and the stress levels are finally starting to come down... kinda! This whole academic year felt like one long marathon, and now we're all just catching our breath. Remember those late-night study sessions fueled by chai and sheer desperation? Ah, good times (not really!).
normalised: Hey everyone! So, results are out, and the stress levels are finally starting to come down... kinda! This whole academic year felt like one long marathon, and now we're all just catching our breath. Remember those late-night study sessions fueled by chai and sheer desperation? Ah, good times (not really!).

unnormalised: I gotta say, seeing that marksheet with the numbers staring back at me was a bit surreal. Like, all that effort condensed into a few percentages and grades. My CBSE scores were decent - managed a 92% overall. Not gonna lie, was hoping for a bit more, especially in Maths, where I aimed for a cool 95/100 but ended up with 88. My mom, of course, is already planning my future as an IIT-ian!
normalised: I gotta say, seeing that marksheet with the numbers staring back at me was a bit surreal. Like, all that effort condensed into a few percentages and grades. My C-B-S-E scores were decent - managed a ninety two percent overall. Not gonna lie, was hoping for a bit more, especially in Maths, where I aimed for a cool ninety five divided by one hundred but ended up with eighty eight. My mom, of course, is already planning my future as an I-I-T-ian!

unnormalised: And the competition! It’s insane, right? My friend Aisha scored a 98.5% – talk about a topper! She’s probably already got a seat in the best college in Delhi. I even heard that some students got a perfect 100 in every subject! Like, how even? Guess I should’ve prayed a bit more at the mandir before the exams, hahaha.
normalised: And the competition! It’s insane, right? My friend Aisha scored a ninety eight point five percent – talk about a topper! She’s probably already got a seat in the best college in Delhi. I even heard that some students got a perfect one hundred in every subject! Like, how even? Guess I should’ve prayed a bit more at the mandir before the exams, hahaha.

unnormalised: Speaking of colleges, that's the next big headache. Choosing the right one is like navigating a maze blindfolded. I'm thinking of applying to Delhi University, maybe for a B.Com. course. My elder brother is suggesting I consider Economics, but tbh, numbers give me enough stress already!
normalised: Speaking of colleges, that's the next big headache. Choosing the right one is like navigating a maze blindfolded. I'm thinking of applying to Delhi University, maybe for a B-Com. course. My elder brother is suggesting I consider Economics, but to be honest, numbers give me enough stress already!

unnormalised: Then there’s the whole cut-off situation. Apparently, last year, the cut-off for Shri Ram College of Commerce (SRCC) was, like, 99% for general category students. Seriously? Who gets a 99%? Feels like the pressure to score high is just getting crazier every year.
normalised: Then there’s the whole cut-off situation. Apparently, last year, the cut-off for Shri Ram College of Commerce (S-R-C-C) was, like, ninety nine percent for general category students. Seriously? Who gets a ninety nine percent? Feels like the pressure to score high is just getting crazier every year.

unnormalised: Plus, these entrance exams! I have to prepone my trip to Kerala since I forgot about the CUET dates. The Common University Entrance Test (CUET) is now a thing, and it's just another hoop to jump through. Honestly, sometimes I feel like the education system is just designed to make us all go a little bit crazy.
normalised: Plus, these entrance exams! I have to prepone my trip to Kerala since I forgot about the C-U-E-T dates. The Common University Entrance Test (C-U-E-T) is now a thing, and it's just another hoop to jump through. Honestly, sometimes I feel like the education system is just designed to make us all go a little bit crazy.

unnormalised: My cousin in Mumbai is dealing with similar drama. He’s trying to get into engineering, and the JEE Main scores are his current obsession. He needs to get a good rank to even think about getting into VJTI or IIT Bombay. He told me he scored 210/300, and still isn't confident. He also said something about some normalization scores.
normalised: My cousin in Mumbai is dealing with similar drama. He’s trying to get into engineering, and the J-E-E Main scores are his current obsession. He needs to get a good rank to even think about getting into V-J-T-I or I-I-T Bombay. He told me he scored two hundred and ten divided by three hundred, and still isn't confident. He also said something about some normalization scores.

unnormalised: And the pressure from relatives! "Sharma ji ka beta" is always looming somewhere, isn't he? Apparently, Sharma ji’s beta got a 99.9% and is already interning at Google! Seriously, why can't they just let us breathe?
normalised: And the pressure from relatives! "Sharma ji ka beta" is always looming somewhere, isn't he? Apparently, Sharma ji’s beta got a ninety nine point nine percent and is already interning at Google! Seriously, why can't they just let us breathe?

unnormalised: Anyway, rant over! For now, I’m celebrating with a plate of my favourite golgappas. Maybe I'll start thinking about college applications tomorrow. Or the day after. Who knows?
normalised: Anyway, rant over! For now, I’m celebrating with a plate of my favourite golgappas. Maybe I'll start thinking about college applications tomorrow. Or the day after. Who knows?

unnormalised: So, to all my fellow students out there, congrats on making it through another year! Whether you aced your exams or just barely scraped by, give yourselves a pat on the back. We deserve it! What colleges are you all aiming for? Let me know in the comments! Let's navigate this college application chaos together, shall we?
normalised: So, to all my fellow students out there, congrats on making it through another year! Whether you aced your exams or just barely scraped by, give yourselves a pat on the back. We deserve it! What colleges are you all aiming for? Let me know in the comments! Let's navigate this college application chaos together, shall we?
